content.description:
Interesting climbing on small hand and foot holds. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante rates it 5.8, but it felt much easier than that.

Start at the right end of the face above the two trees just left of broken gully.
7 bolts to cold shuts anchor.

Start climbing below an undercling and continue along the bolt line. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante rates it 5.8, but it felt much easier than that.

The route right of the wide and vegetated crack and left of the two trees.
6 bolts to cold shuts anchor.

Climb the face using the small but many hand and footholds. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante rates it 5.8, but it felt much easier than that.

The middle route on the face between the two broad cracks.
7 bolts to cold shuts anchor.

Start on featured rock and follow the bolt line along the right side of broad crack. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante rates it 5.7, but it felt much easier than that.

First line of bolts from left. Starts left of a fractured rock.
5 bolts to cold shuts anchor.

Interesting climbing on small hand and foot holds. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante rates it 5.8, but it felt much easier than that.

The right route on the face between the two broad cracks.
7 bolts to cold shuts anchor.

Scramble up fractured rock to a small bulge. Overcome the bulge and continue along the bolt line. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante rates it 5.7, but it felt much easier than that.

Third line of bolts from left. Starts left on fractured rock.
5 bolts to cold shuts anchor.

Interesting climbing on small hand and foot holds. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante rates it 5.8, but it felt much easier than that.

Start at the right of the two trees on the right side of the clif
9 bolts to cold shuts anchor.

Interesting climbing on small hand and foot holds. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante rates it 5.8, but it felt much easier than that.

Follows the face right of broken broad crack. Traverses right to shared anchor.
7 bolts to cold shuts anchor.

A nice small climbing area with unique black coral-like limestone slabs. The cliff has about 10 bolted routes. The guidebook grades them mostly 5.8, but they felt more like 5.6. This is a great area to practice footwork on small holds, but all the routes are similar and it may get old quickly. 
  
 While the climbing is fairly easy, beware that a fall on the sharp limestone may reveal the true meaning of the route names.
